$eref.description: The base properties used in all top-level types
$eref.title: core

_88structured-marking.description: A single definition of a structured marking
_88structured-marking.title: structured-marking

___controlled_structures.description: A list of JSONPath statements, rooted at the top-level object that the structured_markings key is contained in, that the marking_refs apply to.

___marking_refs.description: The set of markings applied to the fields selected by the controlled_structures.

___external_ids.description: A list of external identifiers by which this construct may be known.

___link.description: A link to this construct in the external system

___source.description: The source of this ID, i.e. name of an external system.

___revision.description: The revision number of this construct. MUST be omitted if this is the first version, otherwise required.

___type.description: Hardcoded value to indicate what type of construct this is

___created_at.description: Time at which this construct was created.

___marking_refs.description: The set of markings to be applied to this construct

___producer_ref.description: ID to the information source that produced this content

___structured_markings.description: The set of L2 markings to be applied to this construct

___id.description: Globally unique identifier for this construct.

___reference_url.description: A URL pointing to a copy of the documentation that the reference refers to

___reference_title.description: A human-readable title for this object

___reference_type.description: An enum detailing what type of information is referenced

___analysis_by_ref.description: A direct reference containing the Object ID of the Identity who produced or performed the analysis contained in the referenced document. This is not the Identity of who created the STIX Object, but is who performed the analaysis contained in the referenced document. This Object is not related using a Relationship Object as an intermediatary

___ciq-specification.description: A string containing OASIS CIQ-PIL schema 3.0 XML formatted content describing the Identity in more detail

___stix-resolvers.description: The stix_resolvers section lists the ways that this Organization or Individual can accept or provide STIX v2 content. The order of the entries is important as the first options should be tried first, progressing down the list until the last object.

___taxii-2.description: A URL pointing to the main TAXII 2 server for this Organization in the format https://<server>:<port>/<basepath>

___scp.description: An scp connection string pointing to the main SCP STIX share for this Organization in the format <user>@<server>:<port>/<basepath>

___email-pgp.description: An email address that the consumer can use to share PGP encrypted STIX objects with this Organization in the format <person>@<domain-name>

___phone.description: A string describing how to contact the Organization or Individual by phone in order to exchange the STIX information
